abstract: An article on Friday about newly revealed testimony by Kenneth D. Lewis, the chairman of Bank of America, related to the bank’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch misspelled the surname of a lawyer who commented on the testimony. He is Randall W. Bodner, not Bonder.
snippet: An article on Friday about newly revealed testimony by Kenneth D. Lewis, the chairman of Bank of America, related to the bank’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch misspelled the surname of a lawyer who commented on the testimony. He is Randall W. Bodner...
lead_paragraph: An article on Friday about newly revealed testimony by Kenneth D. Lewis, the chairman of Bank of America, related to the bank’s acquisition of Merrill Lynch misspelled the surname of a lawyer who commented on the testimony. He is Randall W. Bodner, not Bonder.

abstract: The former Merrill Lynch chief John A. Thain took aim at Bank of America over its statements regarding the $3.62 billion in bonuses Merrill awarded just days before BofA completed its acquisition of the Wall Street investment bank and brokerage on Jan 1.
lead_paragraph: The former Merrill Lynch chief John A. Thain took aim at Bank of America over its statements regarding the $3.62 billion in bonuses Merrill awarded just days before BofA completed its acquisition of the Wall Street investment bank and brokerage on Jan 1.

headline.main: Thain Says BofA Lied About Merrill Bonuses, Losses
